SEARCH
Package ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.mapping

Class AccessPolicy

java.lang.Object
ru.introguzzle.parsers.common.mapping.AccessPolicy
public final class AccessPolicy extends Object
The AccessPolicy class defines a set of bitmask constants used to specify which field modifiers should be excluded during the mapping or deserialization process. These constants are typically used in combination to control the visibility and inclusion of class fields based on their access modifiers.

This utility class provides predefined exclusion policies that can be leveraged by mapping frameworks to filter out fields that are marked as transient, final, static, or volatile. By configuring these exclusion policies, developers can fine-tune the mapping behavior to suit their specific needs.

Usage Example:


 // Example: Excluding all fields with transient, final, static, or volatile modifiers
 int exclusionPolicy = AccessPolicy.EXCLUDE_ALL;

 // Example: Excluding only transient and static fields
 int customExclusion = AccessPolicy.EXCLUDE_TRANSIENT | AccessPolicy.EXCLUDE_STATIC;

 // Applying the exclusion policy in a hypothetical mapping framework
 mapper.setExclusionPolicy(customExclusion);

Note: The constants in this class are designed to be used as bitmask flags. They can be combined using bitwise OR operations to create custom exclusion policies.

Since:
1.0

  • Field Details

    • EXCLUDE_TRANSIENT

      public static final int EXCLUDE_TRANSIENT
      Excludes fields that are marked as transient.

      The transient modifier indicates that a field should not be serialized. When this exclusion policy is applied, all fields with the transient modifier will be ignored during the mapping or deserialization process.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • EXCLUDE_FINAL

      public static final int EXCLUDE_FINAL
      Excludes fields that are marked as final.

      The final modifier indicates that a field's value cannot be changed once initialized. When this exclusion policy is applied, all fields with the final modifier will be ignored during the mapping or deserialization process.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • EXCLUDE_STATIC

      public static final int EXCLUDE_STATIC
      Excludes fields that are marked as static.

      The static modifier indicates that a field belongs to the class rather than to any specific instance. When this exclusion policy is applied, all fields with the static modifier will be ignored during the mapping or deserialization process.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • EXCLUDE_VOLATILE

      public static final int EXCLUDE_VOLATILE
      Excludes fields that are marked as volatile.

      The volatile modifier indicates that a field may be modified asynchronously by multiple threads. When this exclusion policy is applied, all fields with the volatile modifier will be ignored during the mapping or deserialization process.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • EXCLUDE_PUBLIC

      public static final int EXCLUDE_PUBLIC
      Flag that defines excluding fields that are marked as public policy.
      See Also:

      Flag that defines excluding fields that are marked as protected policy.
      See Also:

      public static final int EXCLUDE_PRIVATE

      public static final int EXCLUDE_SYNTHETIC
      Flag that defines excluding synthetic fields policy
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT

      public static final int DEFAULT
      Represents the default exclusion policy, which excludes all fields marked as transient, final, static, or volatile, or synthetic.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INCLUDE_ALL

      public static final int INCLUDE_ALL
      Includes all fields regardless of their modifiers.

      This constant represents an inclusion policy where no fields are excluded based on their modifiers. When applied, it ensures that all fields, regardless of being transient, final, static, or volatile, are included during the mapping or deserialization process.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NONE

      public static final int NONE
      Flag that defines including all fields policy
      See Also:
